text:
I have looked at a lot of places in the docs and am struggling to find a list of machine name property names for companies, contacts, anything really - only page I find is this listing human readable names.

How can I easily find all property names that I can include in API call to pull the fields I want?

<https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/companies/HubSpot-crm-default-company-properties?_ga=2.58923310.201145341.1683287328-470551247.1683287328&_gl=1*4pvy7s*_ga*NDcwNTUxMjQ3LjE2ODMyODczMjg.*_ga_LXTM6CQ0XK*MTY4MzU0MzAzMy4yLjAuMTY4MzU0MzAzMy4wLjAuMA>..

Hi Chris, you can go to 'Settings' > 'data management > Properties' and on the top right click on 'Export all properties'. You can export an excel or CSV file which includes all properties from all objects together with human readable labels and the corresponding internal names. Its especially useful as you can see data types for each as well as internal values for dropdown lists etc. as attached
Thanks Rowan, I was expecting just a public place to see all the default ones, much appreciated Rowan!

Hi <@U01QVR44MEY>,
Even we are also facing the same Issue, Can you please help to resolve the issue ASAP.

Hello, I am looking for the right place to ask the following question, I am integrating the HubSpot chat widget in my application, the api documentation shows the flow for the identification of an unknown visitor, but something is missing that the user still It shows as unknown visitor, my question before using the <https://api.HubSpot.com/conversations/v3/visitor-identification/tokens/create> endpoint, is it necessary to use any other endpoint to create contact first?
we are working on it.  will update once we have more information
<@U056B0PPT7F> also check out the <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/properties> endpoint

Thanks <@U03REFNRMB3>, I had already seen this page but I just thought there would be a simple default list somewhere (there was, but it was only human readable labels) without having to query the API.

Hello. I’m thinking about how to solve the use case the smartest. I have a HubDB with about 4000 rows. This rows having columns with “Foreign ID”. I pull like names into my 4k list. Now I want to replace one of the employee with another one and he might be on 400 of this 4k rows. How would you achieve that the smartest way as there is not really a filter option the the current API doc or did I miss on that? :slightly_smiling_face: Thank You.

Boa noite,
Estou tentando usar a API do google cloud de 'Text-to-speech' para criar audio dos posts do meu blog. No desenvolvimento local tive avanços e consegui gerar alguns áudios. Mas não consegui entender como fazer a integração via node no design manager. Existe essa possibilidade?

Goodnight,
I'm trying to use the 'Text-to-speech' google cloud API to create audio from my blog posts. In local development I had advances and managed to generate some audios. But I couldn't understand how to do the integration via node in the design manager. Is there such a possibility?
It doesn't exist

You cannot associate attachments to a ticket unfortunately. The attachment is associated to a note then that note is associated to the ticket.

I would use the UI to upload a attachment to the ticket record. And then search for it. For a test first.

I don't know how you got your pipeline setup on how your account create tickets and if you are uploading a file to that creation pipeline.

I would just test uploading a attachment directly to a ticket on the HubSpot UI and after that test your ticket creation pipeline.
Nope you should just be good to create the token, without first having a contact
You could use a serverless function for this, just keep in mind that it needs to generate in 10 seconds otherwise you'll have to setup another endpoint to catch the returned audio clip
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/data/serverless-functions/reference#serverless-json>

with this token I configure the hsConversationsSettings object with these identificationEmail and identificationToken parameters and then use the HubSpotConversations.widget.load() object and call the load function, the chat works but I can't identify the user who writes to me through the chat  I don't see the user email, it say unknow visitor in the chat

what I would like to do is be able to get the user's data such as their email to be able to associate a contact, but not asking for the email in the chat flow rather automatically when the user writes in the chat the information of this user can be received
:wave: Hello, team!
how to use email template give me some ideas

Greetings, <@U01QVR44MEY>! I trust you are doing exceptionally well, as always.
I am reaching out to you with a query that requires your expertise. It has come to my attention that HubSpot will soon be releasing a changelog regarding the enforcement of property validation rules on July 24th. In light of this, I was wondering if there exists an API that can provide information on the rules and validations applicable to object properties.
If such an API exists, it would undoubtedly be a game-changer for other platforms whose customers rely on HubSpot integrations. Your insights on this matter would be greatly appreciated.
